name: Japan
facts: Japan has the world's oldest company, founded in 578 AD.
There are more pets than children in Japan.

name: Brazil
facts: Brazil is home to the Amazon Rainforest.
It was the only country to play in every FIFA World Cup since 1930.

name: Canada
facts: Canada has the longest coastline in the world.
It has more lakes than the rest of the world combined.

name: India
facts: India is the world's largest democracy.
It is the birthplace of chess and yoga.

name: France
facts: France is the most visited country in the world.
It was the first country to ban supermarkets from throwing away food.

name: Australia
facts: Australia has more kangaroos than people.
It is the only continent covered by a single country.

name: Egypt
facts: Egypt is home to the only remaining ancient world wonder – the Great Pyramid of Giza.
The calendar used today originated in ancient Egypt.

name: Germany
facts: Germany is known for having over 1,500 different types of sausages.
It was the first country to adopt daylight saving time in 1916.

name: South Korea
facts: South Korea has one of the fastest internet speeds in the world.
It celebrates a unique holiday called ‘Black Day’ for single people.

name: South Africa
facts: South Africa has three capital cities: Pretoria, Cape Town, and Bloemfontein.
It is home to the Cradle of Humankind, where some of the oldest human fossils were found.
